references.paper_title: On the use and interpretation of certain test criteria for purpose of statistical inference
references.reason: This paper establishes the foundational Neyman-Pearson lemma, which is a cornerstone of binary statistical decision-making and is directly referenced in several examples in this paper.

references.paper_title: Optimizing abstaining classifiers using ROC analysis
references.reason: This paper introduces the Bounded-Improvement and Bounded-Abstention models which are used as examples of binary decision making and are thoroughly discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: On discriminative learning of prediction uncertainty
references.reason: This paper provides the first solution to the Bounded-Abstention model, a key example used in this paper, after it was originally formulated 14 years prior.

references.paper_title: Plugin estimator of selective classification with out-of-distribution detection
references.reason: This paper offers the first complete analytical solution to the SCOD problem, a central example in this paper, demonstrating the importance of a rigorous mathematical approach over heuristics.

references.paper_title: Augmenting softmax information for selective classification with out-of-distribution data
references.reason: This paper introduces the SCOD problem, a significant example and key focus of this paper, which combines the Neyman-Pearson and Bounded-Abstention problems.
